reviews.review_msg: Good attitude, good sense of humour, and good slides. This class taught me a lot about statistics and many of the key things to remember about both linear and logistic regression. I recommend to anyone who is a serious poli sci major or is interested in statistics for poli sci.

His first undergrad was in Physics. So the science part of political science is the key to a good grade in this course. If pol201 didn't make you smile I'd avoid 315 unless you enjoy failing hilariously. Ask him a question and be prepared to hear EVERYTHING about what you asked about. He probably dreams in binary.

Mark is a fantastic prof and a great person.  The guy has forgotten more about statistics than most people will ever know.  If you want to walk out of a class with more marketable skills than the grad students at SFU, take his class.  If you struggled in 201, then run.
Pol 315 is not fun. It's extremely difficult, especially online. It was my most difficult course in my education. But Steve is great. He's tough but fair, and he was always willing to help out.

Useless. The lecture used to be 4 hours, but he always leave early - make the lecture become 3 hours. He only read throughs the powerpoint slides. The course base on the R script to analysis, but he does not explain the R script in the class so much. Conclusion: Waste my time

Beauvais is lazy, sabotages students, assigns post-graduate readings, and gives incomplete lectures. She didn't teach many things she tested for. In a quiz she asked how many kids she had--her 80 year old dog was a child. I dropped from 70% to 50% on a grade because I didn't add the loading code to the pdf and used N instead of N-1 for sample size.
I really enjoyed taking her class, it was definitely challenging however she was really available to students for extra help.
Unclear about instructions, the midterm was so long that no one was able to complete it, and unclear feedback
Great prof, would 100% take a class with her again.

David is a good prof who made a fairly boring subject quite interesting and engaging. Most of the grade is based on exams, so you need to make sure you study and know the material well (there is a lot of it!!)

The most incredible prof I've ever had in my 4 years of school. Genuinely cares and listens to his students, and is very knowledgeable. A good chunk of your mark is based on participation, but after reading the assigned pieces you'll have no issues with wanting to participate. Brb while I track down another course he's teaching.
